title: Secret Area
historical_context: This article reflects the early days of hacking culture where magazines often included secret sections accessible only through passwords, fostering a sense of community and exclusivity.
target_audience: Hackers, phreakers, and enthusiasts of hacker culture.
short_summary: The article discusses the absence of a secret area in the latest issue of 29A Magazine, while providing passwords for accessing secret content from previous issues.
summary: In this brief note, the authors express their regret over not being able to include a secret area in the third issue of 29A Magazine. They assure readers that they are committed to bringing back this feature in future editions. The article also provides passwords for accessing the secret areas from the first two issues, namely '29akewl' for issue 1 and 'crclabs' for issue 2. This practice of including secret content was common in early hacker publications, creating an engaging experience for readers and fostering a sense of belonging within the hacker community.
